data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
People will always face someone in the first situation. People typically never return to their starting point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 4 steps and turn around. If you follow the instructions you return to the starting point. Thus, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Let's look at the instructions in more detail: Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You should not take less than 1 step to get back to the starting point. You should turn your attention. The starting point is to the right of the point to turn left. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn left and take 3 steps. Take 4 steps and turn left. Take 3 steps and turn right. Take 5 steps to get to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around and take 7 steps to get to the starting point. If you were going to that location, you would not be reverting to that location. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The number 9 equals 9 steps and the number 8 equals 8. In order to get to the starting point you turn right three times. So, the answer is Yes.

Before you take 2 steps, you are already walking back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

The directions are for people to face forward. People take forward when needed. There are 6 ways to repeat the directions. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 3 steps in 1 direction you take 9 steps. It is not even right to take 2 steps at the same time of turning around. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Always facing forward, there is no reason to take one step backward. So, the answer is no.

If you always always face forward, the situation is the same. It is a problem if you begin with 6 steps backward, face forward, and then take 9 more steps right. If you begin with 8 steps right, turn left and that brings you to the starting point. If you continue taking 6 steps backward, turn right, and that brings you to the starting point. So, the answer is no.

If you face forward, you always take 9 steps left. If you face forward, take 10 steps left. If you take 3 steps left, you always take 3 steps left. If you take 3 steps backward, you always take 3 steps backward. If you take 9 steps left, take 3 steps left. If you take 9 steps to the right, take 9 steps left. Thus, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The instructions have 3 different directions for what to do: Take 4 steps left, Take 3 steps forward, Take 1 step right, whichever is necessary. They are the same instructions. So, the answer is No.

If you follow the instructions, and always look right, you always take 3 steps right. Therefore, the answer is Yes.

Turn around right. Turn around left. Turn around left. Turn around right. So, the answer is Yes.

If you zigzagging you will lose. If you continue like this on every step you are going to take, to be on the safe side you may take more steps which is less than the first step required. You took 7 steps to get back to your starting point after coming from the opposite direction of the direction you were going to take the first step. You also took 7 steps to get back to the start of the path if you came from the same direction of the direction of travel. The instructions also says you took 10 steps to get back to the starting point after coming from the same direction of the direction of travel. So, the answer is No.

The first instruction says to face forward. The second instruction says to take two steps backward. The third instruction says to take three steps backward. So, the answer is no.

In this process, you are taking 9 steps and you'll turn about 1 mile after taking those 9 steps. If you take the same amount of steps you traveled to take the same number of steps (in 9 steps), it will turn around and run the same distance. So, the answer is yes.
